posts.post_content:
Such an amazing card...it was a staple in my [Auratog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Auratog) deck since [Rancor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rancor) renders the drawback null and void, but nowadays I would use it with [Aspect of Mongoose](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aspect of Mongoose) or [Spirit Loop](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spirit Loop).   
  
A trampling 9/9 with shroud or lifelink for five mana and no drawback is definitely something to consider.

Posted By: Arachnos (8/15/2012 3:51:23 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[Rancor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rancor), [Brilliant Halo](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brilliant Halo), and [Launch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Launch) are even on the same block as this.  
  
Every one knows the Urza block was the first *unofficial* artifact block before the official Mirrodin block. But in fact is was the *unofficial* enchantment block as evidenced by Endless Wurm and [Pariah](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pariah), [No Mercy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=No Mercy), [Sneak Attack](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sneak Attack), [Glorious Anthem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glorious Anthem), [Opposition](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Opposition), [Worship](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Worship), and [Opalescence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Opalescence). As of now, it is the one and only enchantment block, *unofficially*.
posts.html:
Rancor, Brilliant Halo, and Launch are even on the same block as this.

Every one knows the Urza block was the first unofficial artifact block before the official Mirrodin block. But in fact is was the unofficial enchantment block as evidenced by Endless Wurm and Pariah, No Mercy, Sneak Attack, Glorious Anthem, Opposition, Worship, and Opalescence. As of now, it is the one and only enchantment block, unofficially.

Posted By: acolyte_of_night (6/6/2012 1:50:28 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Angelic destiny doesn't replace rancor. Rancor triggers when Rancor dies, not enchanted creature. Angelic Destiny triggers when the creature itself dies. With Rancor you can sac Rancor to pay for Endless Wurm's upkeep and keep bringing it back. You can't do that with Angelic Destiny.  
  
Isn't that overkill, anyway? With Rancor he's still a 11/9 trampler. I don't really see why you'd need first strike or flying on that.
posts.html:
Angelic destiny doesn't replace rancor. Rancor triggers when Rancor dies, not enchanted creature. Angelic Destiny triggers when the creature itself dies. With Rancor you can sac Rancor to pay for Endless Wurm's upkeep and keep bringing it back. You can't do that with Angelic Destiny.

Isn't that overkill, anyway? With Rancor he's still a 11/9 trampler. I don't really see why you'd need first strike or flying on that.
